Package ohos.light.agent

Class LightAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.light.agent.LightAgent

  • public class LightAgent
extends Object
    Manages lights on hardware devices.

    This class allows you to query a light based on its ID, check whether the light supports a specific blinking effect, enable the light to blink with a certain effect, and turn on or off the light.

    Since:
    1
    See Also:
    LightEffect
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Sensors#MISC_DEVICE

    • Method Detail

      • getLightIdList

        public List<Integer> getLightIdList​()
        Obtains the IDs of all lights on the device.

        This method can be used when you want to query the IDs of all lights on the device.

        Returns:
        Returns the IDs of all lights on the device.
        Since:
        1

      • isSupport

        public boolean isSupport​(int lightId)
        Checks whether a specified light exists on the hardware device.

        This method can be used when you do not know whether a light exists on the device.

        Parameters:
        lightId - Indicates the ID of the light. You can use the getLightIdList() method to obtain the light ID list.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light exists; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • isEffectSupport

        public boolean isEffectSupport​(int lightId,
                               String effectId)
        Checks whether a specified light supports a preset blinking effect.

        Call this method to check whether the light supports a specific blinking effect before enabling the light to blink with this effect.

        Parameters:
        lightId - Indicates the ID of the light. You can use the getLightIdList() method to obtain the light ID list.
        effectId - Indicates the preset blinking effect, which is described in LightEffect.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light supports the specified blinking effect; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • turnOn

        public boolean turnOn​(int lightId,
                      String effectId)
        Turns on a specified light to perform a one-shot blink with a preset blinking effect.
        Parameters:
        lightId - Indicates the ID of the light. You can use the getLightIdList() method to obtain the light ID list.
        effectId - Indicates the preset blinking effect, which is described in LightEffect.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light blinks as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the preset blinking effect is not supported.
        Since:
        1

      • turnOn

        public boolean turnOn​(int lightId,
                      LightEffect lightEffect)
        Turns on a specified light to perform a one-shot blink with a custom effect.

        You can customize a blinking effect in LightEffect.

        Parameters:
        lightId - Indicates the ID of the light. You can use the getLightIdList() method to obtain the light ID list.
        lightEffect - Indicates a custom blinking effect. The custom blinking effects can be obtained using LightEffect(LightBrightness, int, int).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light blinks as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the custom blinking effect is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        LightEffect

      • turnOn

        public boolean turnOn​(String effectId)
        Turns on this light to perform a one-shot blink with a preset blinking effect.
        Parameters:
        effectId - Indicates the preset blinking effect, which is described in LightEffect.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light blinks as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the preset blinking effect is not supported.
        Since:
        1

      • turnOn

        public boolean turnOn​(LightEffect lightEffect)
        Turns on this light to perform a one-shot blink with a custom blinking effect.

        You can customize a blinking effect in LightEffect.

        Parameters:
        lightEffect - Indicates a custom blinking effect. The custom blinking effects can be obtained using LightEffect(LightBrightness, int, int).
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light blinks as expected; returns false otherwise, for example, the custom blinking effect is not supported.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        LightEffect

      • turnOff

        public boolean turnOff​(int lightId)
        Turns off a specified light.

        This method can be used to turn off the light when you no longer need it.

        Parameters:
        lightId - Indicates the ID of the light. You can use the getLightIdList() method to obtain the light ID list.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the light is turned off; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • turnOff

        public boolean turnOff​()
        Turns off this light.

        This method can be used to turn off the light when you no longer need it.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the light is turned off; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1
